title: Burghfield Wokefield Common Walking Route

images.title: Graham Horn / Wokefield Common
images.caption: Wokefield Common. The north-eastern part of the extensive woodland of the area. This common is managed by West Berkshire Council (formerly Newbury District Council whose sign is still here 11 years after that council ceased to exist).

images.title: Darren Smith / Wokefield Common
images.caption: Wokefield Common. This area of woodland between Burghfield Common and Mortimer contains ponds, a nature reserve, and footpaths.

images.title: Subarite, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Mortimer Common Barrows

images.title: Darren Smith / Burghfield Common
images.caption: Burghfield Common. The Eastern part of this square has some of the village of Burghfield Common. This is a view from Hollybush Lane, looking SW over the fields that dominate the rest of the square.

description: This walk explores Wokefield Common Nature Reserve in Burghfield Common, West Berkshire. The common is criss crossed by a number of wide footpaths with woodland trails, ponds and lots of wildlife to see. There is a car park off Goring Lane from which you can start your walk. You can extend the walk by heading south to visit Starvale Woods and Mortimer Common.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland trails are ideal for a dog walk so expect to see other owners on a fine day.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head north and you can enjoy canal walks and a visit to the wildlife rich Hosehill Lake Nature Reserve on the Theale Walk. The St James' Way pilgrimage route passes through the area. The long distance waymarked trail can be followed north to the historic ruins of Reading Abbey or south to Southampton.

display_address: Wokefield, Mortimer, Burghfield Common, West Berkshire, England, RG7 3JG, United Kingdom
